intro: Chaetocarpus pungens, commonly known as the spiny sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to coastal regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like structures and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. It typically grows along the shoreline, where it is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Chaetocarpus pungens is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
